utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ohh. Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, y’know I'm not that much of a sweet tooth. I——Wow. My God, so creamy. Oh my God, this is the best cheesecake I have ever had. Where did you get this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It was at the front door. When I got home. Somebody sent it to us.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, this is not addressed to you. This is addressed to Mrs. Braverman downstairs. Thief.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I—no! I didn't read the box before I opened it. And you can't return a box after you've opened the box.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why, why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because it's too delicious.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, you stole this cheesecake. That is wrong.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no! It is going to be okay, because Mrs. Braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! The only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate, Momma’s Little Bakery. I feel terrible, I’m a horrible, horrible, horrible person.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I should get going, big day a work. Y’know I’m in a coma? Today, they do this test on me and it turns out I’m not brain dead.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah-ah-ah Mr. Smartie Pants, it’s just not my character that’s not brain dead. Hey, so Pheebs, we still on for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’ll see you at 8:00.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, what’s at 8:00?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I have dinner plans with Joey. We get together about once a month to discuss the rest of you guys.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow, did not know that! May I say how lovely you look today?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Duly noted.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks. Oh! So for tomorrow, do you want to rent a car and drive down together or what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Cousin Frannie’s wedding, its tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You were invited?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My God, I can’t believe this! I mean I knew that mom and dad were invited, but I thought that was it! I mean from the ages 7 to 9 Frannie and I were inseparable!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, maybe since the age of 9, Frannie’s made some new friends.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well l-look okay, it’s probably just a mistake. Let me call Aunt Sheryl okay? Maybe you are invited and the invitation just got lost in the mail.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well you call her and tell her that y’know when we were kids her precious little Frannie tried to undress me several times, okay? And if I hadn’t have stopped her, there probably wouldn’t even be a wedding to go too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, she tried to undress me too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I used to undress my cousin Glenn.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joseph Francis Tribbiani are you home yet?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, I think he’s still out. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I’ll tell you Rachel Karen Green, I had plans with Joey tonight and he left me this note.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: "Pheebs, can’t make it, got a date. Talk to you later. Big Daddy." Big Daddy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’s a nickname we were trying out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what nickname never caught on? The Ross-A-Tron!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Here’s Joseph Francis!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-Wha-Ho! What are you middle naming me for?! I left you a note!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So what?! That doesn’t give you the right to ditch me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, you can cancel plans with friends if there is the possibility for sex!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe he’s right, that is the rule.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t accept this rule. When me make plans, I expect you to show up. Okay, I can’t just be a way to kill time ‘til you meet someone better! Y’know boyfriends and girlfriends come and go, but this is for life!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! I’m so sorry; I had no idea it would bother you this much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it does.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, can I-can I make it up to you? Huh? I’m sorry. How about uh, dinner tomorrow night?! I’ll pay for myself!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, you wore me down.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Joe, while you’re over there how about another beer for the Ross-A-Tron?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The Ross—Is that back?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Another cheesecake came! They delivered it to the wrong address again!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So just bring it back downstairs, what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t seem to say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you serious?! Chandler, we ate an entire cheesecake two days ago and you want more?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well I’ve forgotten what it tastes like okay?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It was cheesecake. It was fine. It had a buttery, crumbly, graham cracker crust, with a very rich yet light, cream cheese filling… Wow! My whole mouth just filled with saliva!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what? Forget it! We are just hungry! We have not had lunch! We are just light-headed! So let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah and we’ll drop it off downstairs so that we’re not tempted.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good idea. Where do you want to go to lunch?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Momma’s Little Bakery, Chicago, Illinois.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Awww! Mel Torme died.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, that paper’s like a year old!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aw! Does that mean the Sam Goody’s sale is over?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So I finally heard back from Aunt Sheryl and apparently it wasn’t a mistake. Ahh, there’s-there’s limited seating in the hall.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Limited seating?! I am just one tiny person!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well yeah, but she doesn’t know that. I mean, the last time she saw you-you would’ve turned one of those little wedding chairs into kindling.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Limited seating! Oh, that is such a lame excuse! That’s not the reason she’s not inviting me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh what’s the big deal?! I wasn’t even invited to the ceremony, just the reception. And-and y’know what? If it makes you feel any better, Joan and I will just make an appearance and then, and then we’ll-we’ll leave early as a sign of protest.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joan?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, Joan Tedeski my date. She’s an assistant professor in the Linguistics department. Tall, very beautiful, and despite what some people say, not broad backed!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you got Ross Gellar and guest?! I wasn’t invited and you got "and guest?!"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-uh, excuse me, I do have to interrupt on Ross’s behalf. I-I think the rule applies here y’know, since she has a chance to get on broad back…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not broad backed!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, y’know, you’re bringing me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? I can’t cancel on Joan!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bec—Did you not hear me?! She’s an assistant professor in the Linguistics department, okay? They’re wild! Why do you want to come anyway?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because! She’s my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! We’re family y’know? Well that’s important to me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, all right, I’ll take you. I’ll go call Joan.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aww that’s nice. Family should be there, huh? This is her wedding, happiest day of her life.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, thank you for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wait a minute, I didn’t pay, I thought you paid!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So apparently we just don’t pay for food anymore. Do you see what I see?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Its still there!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mrs. Braverman must be out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She could be out of town. Maybe she’ll be gone for months.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: By then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. We don’t want her to come back to bad cheesecake.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No that could kill her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, we don’t want that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No so we’re protecting her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But we should take it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But we should move quick.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because I think I just heard her moving around in there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! That’s David!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: David who?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: David the scientist guy, David that I was in love with, David who went to Russia and broke my heart David!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you say someone’s name enough, they turn around.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: David! What-what are you doing here? Aren’t you supposed to be in Russia?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just, I’m just in town for a conference. Umm, God you look phenomenal!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well… Yeah. You look great too. Did you get a haircut?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Yeah. Well I-I got like thirty of them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Umm, look I-I-I got a confession to make…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Uh, I-I-I was hoping to run into you here. I didn’t know whether I should call or not, y’know I-I was only in town for a few days. And y’know, I didn’t want to intrude on your life or-or anything like that, but I-I really wanted to see you and—but I didn’t know if you wanted to see me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, of course I would want to see you. I…I think about you all the time.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Really? Because I think about you all the time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: I mean, there’s a statue in Minsk…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: That reminds me of you so much, I mean umm, it-it’s actually of Lenin. But, y’know at certain angles…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Umm, anyway…Do you want to have dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! Oh no!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh. Uh, what?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t. I can’t believe I have plans, I can’t. Can you do it tomorrow night though?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Uh no, I have to go in a few hours. I have to be on the red-eye. Well listen, y’know, next time you’re in Minsk umm…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I have plans with Joey tonight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So! He’ll understand!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No he won’t. And that’s not even the point! Monica, I made a whole speech about you do not cancel plans with friends! And now y’know what? Just because, potentially, the love of my life comes back from Russia just for one night, I-I should change my beliefs?! I should change beliefs! No! No! No, if I don’t have my principles, I don’t have anything!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: God, you are so strong.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or! I should rush through dinner with Joey and I can meet David at 9:00!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! That is so good!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m full, and yet I know if I stop eating this, I’ll regret it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What do you got there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh it’s umm, it’s tofu cake. Do you want some?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing tonight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh? Uh…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dude! Dude!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Sorry. Uh, I’ve got those plans with Phoebe, why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh really? Uh, Monica said she had a date at 9:00.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! Tonight?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s what Monica said.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: After she gave me that big speech?! She goes and makes a date with a guy on the same night she has plans with me? I think she’s trying to pull a fast one on Big Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh here, I think this is us. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Limited seating my ass. Let’s see who made the cut. Hi!

utterance.speaker: The Wedding Guest
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m Monica Gellar. Who do you know the bride and groom?

utterance.speaker: The Wedding Guest
utterance.content: Oh, I used to work with Frannie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Used to work with her. Used to! I’m a relative and I didn’t get invited! A blood relative! Blood!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Stop saying, "Blood" to strangers.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, how about you huh? How do you know the happy couple?

utterance.speaker: The Second Guest
utterance.content: We went to college with both of them and now we live next door.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, you’re fine.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Are you guys ready?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! I will have the green salad, umm the house salad, and water’s fine.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: And for you sir?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, this slow roasted salmon, just how slow are we talkin’ here?

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: It’s uh, it’s already been roasted.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh, then no. Maybe I should hear those specials again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Joey, we’ve heard the specials three times! Okay? There’s prime rib, mahi mahi, and a very special lobster ravioli.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Actually we’re out of the lobster ravioli.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well, that changes everything! Y’know what Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You were right before. I mean, friends are so important.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m very wise. I know.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know-y’know what I really want?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is to have a long, long talk. Y’know? Get Joey out on the open road and really open him up.

utterance.speaker: The Waiter
utterance.content: Any progress?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! I will have the lobster ravioli.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: God Joey, this is taking forever!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s the rush? What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: W-w—I just—it’s that—I have—y’know I have-I have an appointment. And it’s very important.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well… It’s a date.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A date?! No, no Pheebs you-you must be mistaken, because I know you wouldn’t schedule a date on the same night you have plans with a friend!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on Joey, don’t make me feel badly about this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I’m gonna!! That’s right! Yeah, you made me feel really guilty about goin’ out with that girl! Like-like-like I did something terrible to you! And now Pheebs, you’re doing the same thing!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That—It’s not the same thing! This is totally different! This is with David! Remember David, the scientist guy? Okay, he’s very special to me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, well my girl from the other night was special. She was a scientist too!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She was?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, she graduated from high school!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, whatever. Y’know what? I don’t have time have time to convince you because he’s only here for four hours, and I’m gonna go see him!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you still doin’ here?! I told you, lobster ravioli!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Hey! Oh, I was just about to leave. I-I-I-I didn’t think you were coming.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I wouldn’t miss this.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Well, I’m very glad you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you’re such a gentleman. Come on! We’re going to my place!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you eating the cheesecake without me?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I will give you a hundred dollars to whistle right now. How can you eat the cheesecake without me?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, what are you going to do?! Are you gonna go run tell Monica?! Are you gonna tell Joey?! No! Because then you will have to tell them what we did! We are desert stealers! We are living outside the law!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what? I don’t trust you with this cake anymore! And I got it first, and I’m takin’ it back!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait a minute!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no-no, no you don’t!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes! Oh yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You think I trust you with it?! No! We’re gonna split it! You take half and I take half!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well that’s not fair, you’ve already had some!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Oh, well then y’know what? I think Monica would be very interested to know that you called her cheesecake dry and mealy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What do we use to split it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! All right, pick a half.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay well, this side looks bigger. Uh… There’s more crust on this side. Y’know? So, maybe if I measured…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh for God sake just pick a piece!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I’ll pick that one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s also the smaller piece. Okay, there you go. Enjoy your half my friend, but that is it. No sharing. No switching, and don’t come crying to me if you eat your piece to fast. Oh!!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ohhh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you gotta give me some of your piece.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-ho-ho-ho-no! No! No switching! No sharing, and don’t come crying to me! Ha-ha-ha! I may just sit here and have my cake all day! Just sit here in the hallway and eat my…

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Ross, sweetheart!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, hey Aunt Millie.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Millie
utterance.content: Isn’t it a beautiful wedding?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, yes it is. It’s uh… Every time on the lips! Why?! Why on lips?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here’s Frannie. Hmm, won’t she be happy to see me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now wait a minute, you be nice! All right? I didn’t bring you here so you can ambush her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Frannie was the one who found your Playboys and showed them to mom.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That bitch!

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: Monica! What…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Am I doing here? Why? Surprised to see me? Ross brought me. How do you like that?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi Frannie, congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You invite my brother, you invite my whole family, and not me?! Why?! What—Why wouldn’t you want me at your wedding? What could I have possibly done?! Stuart!

utterance.speaker: Frannie
utterance.content: I believe you know my husband.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So it’s really a question of who could you have possibly done.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Oh, I hate this but I-I-I have to go. I-I can’t miss my flight.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you sure? I’ll bet there’s another flight to Minsk in like…

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: July. Umm,

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s really beautiful. What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Please, clean my beakers. I don’t get out of the lab much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s good. I got to admit, I thought it was something else.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Yeah, I… Well I really actually wanted to say umm, that, but um, I figured I probably shouldn’t because y’know, I…have to leave.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re right! You’re right. Don’t say it.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: I-I do though.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I do too.

utterance.speaker: David
utterance.content: Bye Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, now’s not the time Joey. All right? You can yell at me tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No! No Pheebs, I’m not gonna yell at you. I just y’know, started thinking about you and David and I…remember how bummed you were the first time he left. And I just… Oh Pheebs, come here. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No I’m not okay. The only guy I’ve ever been crazy about has gone to Minsk and I may never…I may never see him again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, y’know you could always visit him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh right, like they’re gonna let me have a passport.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Anything I can do? Whatever you need.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well—But—Now, if-if you can achieve positronic distillation of sub-atomic particles y’know before he does, then he can come back.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can give it a shot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Yay! Look! There’s a piece that doesn’t have floor on it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Stick to your side!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, come on now!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, what are we havin’?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait I forgot my wrap.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Oh, okay. Wait here.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Millie
utterance.content: Hi sweetie! Are you leaving?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Aunt Millie
utterance.content: Give us a kiss. Come on! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why?! Why on the lips?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, when’s this comet thing start?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, technically it seven billion years ago…

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh no! Oh no!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! Fine, I’ll stop! No teaching, okay? We’ll just watch the pretty light streaking across the sky. Okay? Who’s official name is Bapstein-King.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Okay! Okay!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There it is! Oh, look at that! Isn’t Mother Nature amazing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s a plane!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, all right. 1700 bags of peanuts flying that high, that’s pretty amazing too.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Hey, I wonder if you can see my apartment from up here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. No, you can’t.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh I don’t-I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Man, look at all those stars! Infinite space. It really, really makes you wonder, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know what else makes you wonder?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check out the rack on this chick!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandler’s getting chilly.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I’m not!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then why are you wearing Monica’s jacket?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because it’s flattering! Come on Monica! Come on Monica!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah actually, I think we’re gonna take off too. We rented a movie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! I won’t say, ‘no’ to a movie!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh Pheebs, we just actually kinda wanted to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Shh! Get me out of here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come here, check this out!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Is it the comet?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No-no. Look, there’s a bug stuck in tar right here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey come—I can’t believe—I bring you here to see the Bapstein-King comet, one of nature’s most spectacular phenomenon, and all you care about are bugs stuck in tar and-and some woman!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know, there’s two women dude.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Show me where?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right-right up here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey where’s the pipe that was holding the door open?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know! Yeah, I do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! All right—Hey! Don’t look at me! You’re the one who wanted to come up and look for some stupid Burger King comet!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s called the Bapstein-King comet, okay? Hey! Hey! Bapstein was a very well respected astronomer!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no! No! No!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s sleeping.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know, just quick-quick question, quick question. Which one was Deep Impact and which one was Armageddon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Deep Impact was the one with Robert Duval, Armageddon is what’s going to happen to you if you wake me up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry, I just…can’t sleep. Ooh! Where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? Because every time I look at that cover I’m like…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It is in the living room where there is also a light! And no one will kick you in the shin.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?! Ow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Please don’t be a space ship. Please don’t be a space ship. Oh thank God! How could you be beeping?! I just disconnected you! I took out your battery! How can…

utterance.speaker: Smoke Detector
utterance.content: Beep!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don’t interrupt me!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rachel!! Monica!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can’t believe this!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right well, y’know…I guess we know what we have to do to get down.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess we don’t have a choice. Help us! Please help us! We’re stuck up on the roof and we can’t get down!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross. I was thinking we could just go down the fire escape.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, I wasn’t finished. But don’t worry! We’re gonna go down the fire escape!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Shhhhhhhhh!!! I’m sorry, I thought maybe I’d make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: With a wok? I thought you were going to read my boring book to put you asleep.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It got interesting! Damn you Oprah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here, let me make the milk, I’m up anyway.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what we can do? Y’know, now that we are up? We can just like talk to each other all night long, y’know like we did when we were first going out. It’d be fun!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay that does sound like fun.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The second sister dies?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. No, I-I was, I was talking about the book I was reading.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The second sister dies in Archie and Jughead Double Digest?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s correct.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You wanna go in the bedroom? It’s a little more comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Oh wait! Umm, did you send those contracts to Milan?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: If this is your idea of sexy talk?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No seriously, y’know the contracts I gave you, did you overnight them?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: What contracts?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay please tell me that this is just one of your jokes that you do that I don’t get.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, like the thing when you put the phone in your pants? Tag! I’m serious! This isn’t funny! Those contracts absolutely had to go out today!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Rach, I’m sorry, but you didn’t give me any contracts!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes I did! And I put a little Post-It on it that said, "Must go out today," and underlined today three times and, and then I put a little heart in the corner because I didn’t want to seem to bossy.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I’m telling you, you never gave them to me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know what Tag, if we went down to the office you would see those contracts sitting on your desk.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: No, I would see you looking embarrassed because they are not on my desk!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Or maybe you would see me looking embarrassed because you are talking on the phone with your crotch!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: You wanna go down to the office right now?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Come on its late, we’re not gonna go down to the office.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Okay I understand. I wouldn’t want to be proved wrong either.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay get your coat! Oh! When did you unhook this? Nice work!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, it won’t go down any further. It’s stuck.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ugh. Well, we’re just gonna have to jump. Yeah. Now, we’re gonna have to make sure to land to the right of that patch of ice, okay? Not hit the dumpster on the other side and uh, and try to avoid that-that weird brownish red stuff in the middle. So, when you get down there…you go up to the roof and you let me in.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh whoa-whoa wait a minute! I have to do it?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! Oh yeah, you’ll be fine! It-it’ll be uh, just like bungy jumping. Y’know? But instead of bouncing back up you-you won’t.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What if I smack my head on the concrete?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’m gonna lie to you Joey, it’s a possibility.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know Ross! I-I tell you what, let’s flip to see who does it, okay? You-you call it in the air, all right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, all right. Tails! Can you-can you see what it is?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Well, you be careful.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? No! No Ross! No-no! Stop! I’m not jumping! Okay, look I have an audition tomorrow and I can’t go if I break my leg.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I’m jumping! I have a son! Okay? He won’t have a father if-if I die!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well all right so, it looks like we’re even!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. So, this wire is connected to this wire which plugs into here. Okay so, to get the beeping to stop all I have to do… Well done, Pheebs. What do you want from me?!!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, here’s your milk. What do you want to talk about?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What? What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh! Ohhhh! Were you sleeping sweetie? I’m sorry. Here.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Okay! Feel free to look, but I’m telling you those contracts are not on this desk.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh how can you possibly know? Look at this mess, Tag! I mean, this is what I’m talking about! You have to be organized! You’ve got newspapers! You’ve got magazines! You got—Ohh! And who is this chippy? A little young for you Tag, but whatever.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: It’s my sister.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, very cute braces. Anyway y’know what, the point is Tag, start looking because you are going to find those contracts on your desk.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: So when do you imagine you gave them to me? In the morning or in the afternoon?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: In the afternoon. Mr. Zelner came into my office after lunch. He put them on my desk, and then I put a Post-It on it that said, "Must go out today." So you just keep looking in there! All right?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: It’s not here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Puzzler. A bit of a puzzle. Why don’t you um, check the copy room, maybe you left the contracts in there?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: How could I have left them in the copy room?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know Tag! How can your genitals make phone calls? Okay? It’s not a perfect world! Just go please.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. Hello? I still don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you still awake?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah! You?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You do know that was me who just said that right? Hey. As long as we’re both up…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah? I hope you’re not thinking about cleaning the living room.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, I’m starving! What the hell was I thinking at dinner?! "Do you want soup or salad?" Both! Always order both!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, y’know I’m lookin’ and I don’t think anyone’s home here. I say we just break the window, crawl through, and-and y’know explain later.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah? Really? No one’s home?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t think so. Hello? When you get in there…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, this is where you and I part ways. Noisy bitch!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you know what just happened?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. We-we had sex and then we fell asleep.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. We were in the middle of sex…and you fell asleep.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nooo! No, that’s not true. No, best time ever! Yeah, you rocked me world!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. So please wake up so we can do it right!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, I’m ready. Come on big fella!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Give me the good stuff.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah! No! No! No! Don’t fall asleep! Okay, I am going to make you some coffee. And I probably won’t spill coffee grounds all over the kitchen floor.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’m up! I’m up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! I got you some coffee. To, uh… …fair enough. So! Do you got anything for me?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Still no luck.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Did you check your entire desk! Did you check all the drawers!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Do you want me to check again?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well yeah, I wish that you would. Well, no it’s not in there! How about that drawer?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Well, it’s not out here. Is there any chance it could be in your office?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, I don’t-I don’t know. Let me, let me check.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Can I see you in my office for a minute?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Yeah? You found them!! Y’know what? I’m not even going to gloat. I’m just really relived this whole thing is over.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You put these on my desk!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I did not!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh really? So you’re saying they just slid out of your bottom drawer, crawled across the floor, then jumped on to my desk?!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: How did you know they were in my bottom drawer?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am so hot for you right now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! How did you get back here?!

utterance.speaker: A Disembodied Voice
utterance.content: Phoebe Buffay?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fire alarm? Oh! Hi, officer—fireman, can-can I help you?

utterance.speaker: The Fireman
utterance.content: We found your fire alarm in the trash chute.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s not mine.

utterance.speaker: The Fireman
utterance.content: Yes it is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: The Fireman
utterance.content: The next time you want to dump a fire alarm in a trash chute, don’t wrap it in a blanket that says, "Property of Phoebe Buffay not Monica."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay do you—Okay, do you have a search warrant? Because the last time I checked this was still America!

utterance.speaker: The Fireman
utterance.content: Please reattach this, it’s against the law to disconnect them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine! But please God; tell me how to stop them from going off!

utterance.speaker: The Fireman
utterance.content: There’s a reset button under the plastic cover.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There’s a reset button?! Ugh, thank you! Thank you! There’s a reset button! My God! Why didn’t I see that! Reset button, reset button, where is there a reset button? Oh here it is! Oh! Ohh, God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, do-do you have a good grip?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to start climb down you now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Just hurry up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Now-now-now should I climb down your front so we’re face to face or-or should I climb down your back so we’re-we’re butt to face.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I think face to face.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I would say that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Face to face, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, here I go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my… How much do you weigh Ross?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I prefer not to answer that right now, I’m still carrying a little holiday weight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know, when we talked about face to face, I don’t think we thought it all the way through.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So what do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, just shimmy down me and drop!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: M-maybe I should hang and you can climb down me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah? Maybe we should talk about that for a little while!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s still looks pretty far!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s not that far! Just drop!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do not rush me!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross, you should know that my pants are startin’ to come down and I’m not wearing any underwear!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oww!! My ankle! I really hurt my ankle! I think I twisted it when I—Ooh, a quarter!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That really was some of your best work.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hm-hmm, I told you! I can’t believe that I’ve only got two hours before I call in sick for work.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have to be up in seven minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you’re not gonna believe this, but if you have seven minutes…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you wanna?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! You get the vacuum cleaner and I’ll get the furniture polish!
